member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateLifecyclePolicy operation. Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified Amazon Web Services resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the lifecycle policy. The characters ^[0-9A-Za-z _-]+$ are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.ExecutionRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyDetails.
The configuration details of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags to apply to the lifecycle policy during creation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule
member.summary:
Specifies when to create snapshots of EBS volumes.
You must specify either a Cron expression or an interval, interval unit, and start time. You cannot specify both.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.CronExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CronExpression.
The schedule, as a Cron expression. The schedule interval must be between 1 hour and 1 year. For more information, see Cron expressions in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The interval between snapshots. The supported values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The interval unit.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
Specifies the destination for snapshots created by the policy. To create snapshots in the same Region as the source resource, specify CLOUD. To create snapshots on the same Outpost as the source resource, specify OUTPOST_LOCAL. If you omit this parameter, CLOUD is used by default.
If the policy targets resources in an Amazon Web Services Region, then you must create snapshots in the same Region as the source resource.
If the policy targets resources on an Outpost, then you can create snapshots on the same Outpost as the source resource, or in the Region of that Outpost.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.Times
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Times.
The time, in UTC, to start the operation. The supported format is hh:mm.
The operation occurs within a one-hour window following the specified time. If you do not specify a time, Amazon DLM selects a time within the next 24 hours.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyAction
member.summary: Specifies a rule for copying shared snapshots across Regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyAction.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionConfiguration.
The encryption settings for the copied snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyAction.RetainRule
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RetainRule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyAction.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The target Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyDeprecateRule
member.summary: Specifies an AMI deprecation rule for cross-Region AMI copies created by a cross-Region copy rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyDeprecateRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The period after which to deprecate the cross-Region AMI copies. The period must be less than or equal to the cross-Region AMI copy retention period, and it can't be greater than 10 years. This is equivalent to 120 months, 520 weeks, or 3650 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyDeprecateRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The unit of time in which to measure the Interval.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRetainRule
member.summary: Specifies the retention rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRetainRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRetainRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The unit of time for time-based retention.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule
member.summary: Specifies a rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.CmkArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CmkArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for the account is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.CopyTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyTags.
Indicates whether to copy all user-defined tags from the source snapshot to the cross-Region snapshot copy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.DeprecateRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeprecateRule.
The AMI deprecation rule for cross-Region AMI copies created by the rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.Encrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Encrypted.
To encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot if encryption by default is not enabled, enable encryption using this parameter. Copies of encrypted snapshots are encrypted, even if this parameter is false or if encryption by default is not enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.RetainRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetainRule.
The retention rule that indicates how long snapshot copies are to be retained in the destination Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The target Region or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target Outpost for the snapshot copies.
Use this parameter instead of TargetRegion. Do not specify both.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CrossRegionCopyRule.TargetRegion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetRegion.
Avoid using this parameter when creating new policies. Instead, use Target to specify a target Region or a target Outpost for snapshot copies.
For policies created before the Target parameter was introduced, this parameter indicates the target Region for snapshot copies.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteLifecyclePolicy operation. Deletes the specified lifecycle policy and halts the automated operations that the policy specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteLifecyclePolicy operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeprecateRule
member.summary: Specifies an AMI deprecation rule for a schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeprecateRule.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
If the schedule has a count-based retention rule, this parameter specifies the number of oldest AMIs to deprecate. The count must be less than or equal to the schedule's retention count, and it can't be greater than 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeprecateRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
If the schedule has an age-based retention rule, this parameter specifies the period after which to deprecate AMIs created by the schedule. The period must be less than or equal to the schedule's retention period, and it can't be greater than 10 years. This is equivalent to 120 months, 520 weeks, or 3650 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeprecateRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The unit of time in which to measure the Interval.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the encryption settings for shared snapshots that are copied across Regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EncryptionConfiguration.CmkArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CmkArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for the account is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EncryptionConfiguration.Encrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Encrypted.
To encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot when encryption by default is not enabled, enable encryption using this parameter. Copies of encrypted snapshots are encrypted, even if this parameter is false or when encryption by default is not enabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventParameters
member.summary: Specifies an event that triggers an event-based policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventParameters.DescriptionRegex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DescriptionRegex.
The snapshot description that can trigger the policy. The description pattern is specified using a regular expression. The policy runs only if a snapshot with a description that matches the specified pattern is shared with your account.
For example, specifying ^.*Created for policy: policy-1234567890abcdef0.*$ configures the policy to run only if snapshots created by policy policy-1234567890abcdef0 are shared with your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventParameters.EventType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventType.
The type of event. Currently, only snapshot sharing events are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventParameters.SnapshotOwner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotOwner.
The IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts that can trigger policy by sharing snapshots with your account. The policy only runs if one of the specified Amazon Web Services accounts shares a snapshot with your account.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventSource
member.summary: Specifies an event that triggers an event-based policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventSource.Parameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Parameters.
Information about the event.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.EventSource.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The source of the event. Currently only managed CloudWatch Events rules are supported.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.FastRestoreRule
member.summary: Specifies a rule for enabling fast snapshot restore. You can enable fast snapshot restore based on either a count or a time interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.FastRestoreRule.AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZones.
The Availability Zones in which to enable fast snapshot restore.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.FastRestoreRule.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The number of snapshots to be enabled with fast snapshot restore.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.FastRestoreRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The amount of time to enable fast snapshot restore. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.FastRestoreRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The unit of time for enabling fast snapshot restore.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetLifecyclePolicies operation. Gets summary information about all or the specified data lifecycle policies.
To get complete information about a policy, use GetLifecyclePolicy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.PolicyIds

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.ResourceTypes
member.summary:

The resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The activation state.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.TagsToAdd
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagsToAdd.
The tags to add to objects created by the policy.
Tags are strings in the format key=value.
These user-defined tags are added in addition to the Amazon Web Services-added lifecycle tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.TargetTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetTags.
The target tag for a policy.
Tags are strings in the format key=value.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.Parameters
member.summary: Specifies optional parameters to add to a policy. The set of valid parameters depends on the combination of policy type and resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Parameters.ExcludeBootVolume
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeBootVolume.
[EBS Snapshot Management Instance policies only] Indicates whether to exclude the root volume from snapshots created using CreateSnapshots. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Parameters.NoReboot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NoReboot.
Applies to AMI lifecycle policies only. Indicates whether targeted instances are rebooted when the lifecycle policy runs. true indicates that targeted instances are not rebooted when the policy runs. false indicates that target instances are rebooted when the policy runs. The default is true (instances are not rebooted).

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails
member.summary: Specifies the configuration of a lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.Actions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Actions.
The actions to be performed when the event-based policy is triggered. You can specify only one action per policy.
This parameter is required for event-based policies only. If you are creating a snapshot or AMI policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.EventSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventSource.
The event that triggers the event-based policy.
This parameter is required for event-based policies only. If you are creating a snapshot or AMI policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.Parameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Parameters.
A set of optional parameters for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies.
This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.PolicyType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyType.
The valid target resource types and actions a policy can manage. Specify EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT to create a lifecycle policy that manages the lifecycle of Amazon EBS snapshots. Specify IMAGE_MANAGEMENT to create a lifecycle policy that manages the lifecycle of EBS-backed AMIs. Specify EVENT_BASED_POLICY to create an event-based policy that performs specific actions when a defined event occurs in your Amazon Web Services account.
The default is EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.ResourceLocations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceLocations.
The location of the resources to backup. If the source resources are located in an Amazon Web Services Region, specify CLOUD. If the source resources are located on an Outpost in your account, specify OUTPOST.
If you specify OUTPOST, Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager backs up all resources of the specified type with matching target tags across all of the Outposts in your account.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.ResourceTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypes.
The target resource type for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies. Use VOLUME to create snapshots of individual volumes or use INSTANCE to create multi-volume snapshots from the volumes for an instance.
This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.Schedules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedules.
The schedules of policy-defined actions for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies. A policy can have up to four schedulesone mandatory schedule and up to three optional schedules.
This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.TargetTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetTags.
The single tag that identifies targeted resources for this policy.
This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule
member.summary: Specifies the retention rule for a lifecycle policy. You can retain snapshots based on either a count or a time interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The number of snapshots to retain for each volume, up to a maximum of 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The unit of time for time-based retention.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule
member.summary: Specifies a backup schedule for a snapshot or AMI lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.CopyTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyTags.
Copy all user-defined tags on a source volume to snapshots of the volume created by this policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.CreateRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreateRule.
The creation rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.CrossRegionCopyRules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrossRegionCopyRules.
The rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.
You can only specify cross-Region copy rules for policies that create snapshots in a Region. If the policy creates snapshots on an Outpost, then you cannot copy the snapshots to a Region or to an Outpost. If the policy creates snapshots in a Region, then snapshots can be copied to up to three Regions or Outposts.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.DeprecateRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeprecateRule.
The AMI deprecation rule for the schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.FastRestoreRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FastRestoreRule.
The rule for enabling fast snapshot restore.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.RetainRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetainRule.
The retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.ShareRules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShareRules.
The rule for sharing snapshots with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.TagsToAdd
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagsToAdd.
The tags to apply to policy-created resources. These user-defined tags are in addition to the Amazon Web Services-added lifecycle tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.VariableTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VariableTags.
A collection of key/value pairs with values determined dynamically when the policy is executed. Keys may be any valid Amazon EC2 tag key. Values must be in one of the two following formats: $(instance-id) or $(timestamp). Variable tags are only valid for EBS Snapshot Management Instance policies.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.ShareRule
member.summary: Specifies a rule for sharing snapshots across Amazon Web Services accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.ShareRule.TargetAccounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetAccounts.
The IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts with which to share the snapshots.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.ShareRule.UnshareInterval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnshareInterval.
The period after which snapshots that are shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts are automatically unshared.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.ShareRule.UnshareIntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnshareIntervalUnit.
The unit of time for the automatic unsharing interval.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing DLM
Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager
With Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager, you can manage the lifecycle of your Amazon Web Services resources. You create lifecycle policies, which are used to automate operations on the specified resources.
Amazon DLM supports Amazon EBS volumes and snapshots. For information about using Amazon DLM with Amazon EBS, see Automating the Amazon EBS Snapshot Lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDLMClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
